verses.verse: ( David’s Last Song) וְאֵ֛לֶּה <WH428> wə·’êl·leh These דִּבְרֵ֥י <WH1697> diḇ·rê words דָוִ֖ד <WH1732> ḏā·wiḏ of David: הָאַֽחֲרֹנִ֑ים <WH314> hā·’a·ḥă·rō·nîm are the last נְאֻ֧ם <WH5002> nə·’um “ The oracle דָּוִ֣ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ of David בֶּן־ <WH1121> ben- son יִשַׁ֗י <WH3448> yi·šay of Jesse, וּנְאֻ֤ם <WH5002> ū·nə·’um the oracle הַגֶּ֙בֶר֙ <WH1397> hag·ge·ḇer of the man הֻ֣קַם <WH6965> hu·qam raised עָ֔ל <WH5920> ‘āl on high, מְשִׁ֙יחַ֙ <WH4899> mə·šî·aḥ the one anointed אֱלֹהֵ֣י <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·hê by the God יַֽעֲקֹ֔ב <WH3290> ya·‘ă·qōḇ of Jacob, וּנְעִ֖ים <WH5273> ū·nə·‘îm and the sweet זְמִר֥וֹת <WH2158> zə·mi·rō·wṯ psalmist יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ <WH3478> yiś·rā·’êl of Israel: ( Or the hero of the songs of Israel or the favorite of the Strong One of Israel)

ר֥וּחַ <WH7307> rū·aḥ The Spirit יְהוָ֖ה <WH3068> Yah·weh of the LORD דִּבֶּר־ <WH1696> dib·ber- spoke through בִּ֑י Prep│1cs ( bî) me; וּמִלָּת֖וֹ 4405 Conj-w│N-fsc│3ms ( ū·mil·lā·ṯōw) His word עַל־ 5921 Prep ( ‘al-) was on לְשׁוֹנִֽי׃ 3956 N-csc│1cs ( lə·šō·w·nî) my tongue.

אָמַר֙ <WH559> ’ā·mar spoke; אֱלֹהֵ֣י <WH430> ’ĕ·lō·hê The God יִשְׂרָאֵ֔ל <WH3478> yiś·rā·’êl of Israel לִ֥י Prep│1cs ( lî) to me, דִבֶּ֖ר 1696 V-Piel-Perf-3ms ( ḏib·ber) said צ֣וּר 6697 N-msc ( ṣūr) the Rock יִשְׂרָאֵ֑ל 3478 N-proper-ms ( yiś·rā·’êl) of Israel מוֹשֵׁל֙ 4910 V-Qal-Prtcpl-ms ( mō·wō·šêl) ‘ He who rules בָּאָדָ֔ם 120 Prep-b, Art│N-ms ( bā·’ā·ḏām) the people צַדִּ֕יק 6662 Adj-ms ( ṣad·dîq) with justice, מוֹשֵׁ֖ל 4910 V-Qal-Prtcpl-ms ( mō·wō·šêl) who rules יִרְאַ֥ת 3374 N-fsc ( yir·’aṯ) in the fear אֱלֹהִֽים׃ 430 N-mp ( ’ĕ·lō·hîm) of God,

וּכְא֥וֹר <WH216> ū·ḵə·’ō·wr is like the light בֹּ֖קֶר <WH1242> bō·qer of the morning יִזְרַח־ <WH2224> yiz·raḥ- ... שָׁ֑מֶשׁ <WH8121> šā·meš at sunrise בֹּ֚קֶר <WH1242> bō·qer dawn, לֹ֣א <WH3808> lō of a cloudless עָב֔וֹת <WH5645> ‘ā·ḇō·wṯ ... מִנֹּ֥גַהּ <WH5051> min·nō·ḡah the glistening מִמָּטָ֖ר <WH4306> mim·mā·ṭār after the rain דֶּ֥שֶׁא <WH1877> de·še on the sprouting grass מֵאָֽרֶץ׃ <WH776> mê·’ā·reṣ of the earth. ’

כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- לֹא־ <WH3808> lō- Is not כֵ֥ן <WH3651> ḵên right בֵּיתִ֖י <WH1004> bê·ṯî my house עִם־ <WH5973> ‘im- with אֵ֑ל <WH410> ’êl God? כִּי֩ <WH3588> kî For בְרִ֨ית <WH1285> ḇə·rîṯ covenant, עוֹלָ֜ם <WH5769> ‘ō·w·lām an everlasting שָׂ֣ם <WH7760> śām He has established לִ֗י Prep│1cs ( lî) with me עֲרוּכָ֤ה 6186 V-Qal-QalPassPrtcpl-fs ( ‘ă·rū·ḵāh) ordered בַכֹּל֙ 3605 Prep-b, Art│N-ms ( ḇak·kōl) in every part. וּשְׁמֻרָ֔ה 8104 Conj-w│V-Qal-QalPassPrtcpl-fs ( ū·šə·mu·rāh) and secured כִּֽי־ 3588 Conj ( kî-) ... כָל־ 3605 N-msc ( ḵāl) my full יִשְׁעִ֥י 3468 N-msc│1cs ( yiš·‘î) salvation וְכָל־ 3605 Conj-w│N-msc ( wə·ḵāl) and my every חֵ֖פֶץ 2656 N-ms ( ḥê·p̄eṣ) desire כִּֽי־ 3588 Conj ( kî-) ...? לֹ֥א 3808 Adv-NegPrt ( lō) Will He not יַצְמִֽיחַ׃ 6779 V-Hifil-Imperf-3ms ( yaṣ·mî·aḥ) bring about

וּבְלִיַּ֕עַל <WH1100> ū·ḇə·lî·ya·‘al But the worthless כְּק֥וֹץ <WH6975> kə·qō·wṣ like thorns מֻנָ֖ד <WH5074> mu·nāḏ raked aside, כֻּלָּ֑הַם <WH3605> kul·lā·ham are all כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- for לֹ֥א <WH3808> lō they can never בְיָ֖ד <WH3027> ḇə·yāḏ by hand. יִקָּֽחוּ׃ <WH3947> yiq·qā·ḥū be gathered

וְאִישׁ֙ <WH376> wə·’îš The man יִגַּ֣ע <WH5060> yig·ga‘ [who] touches בָּהֶ֔ם Prep│3mp ( bā·hem) them יִמָּלֵ֥א 4390 V-Nifal-Imperf-3ms ( yim·mā·lê) must be armed בַרְזֶ֖ל 1270 N-ms ( ḇar·zel) with iron וְעֵ֣ץ 6086 Conj-w│N-msc ( wə·‘êṣ) or with the shaft חֲנִ֑ית 2595 N-fs ( ḥă·nîṯ) of a spear. וּבָאֵ֕שׁ 784 Conj-w, Prep-b, Art│N-cs ( ū·ḇā·’êš) The fire שָׂר֥וֹף 8313 V-Qal-InfAbs ( śā·rō·wp̄) burns them to ashes יִשָּׂרְפ֖וּ 8313 V-Nifal-Imperf-3mp ( yiś·śā·rə·p̄ū) ... בַּשָּֽׁבֶת׃פ 7675 Prep-b, Art│Adj-fs ( baš·šā·ḇeṯ) in [the] place [where they lie]. ”

( David’s Mighty Men) ( 130 11:10-47 ) אֵ֛לֶּה <WH428> ’êl·leh These שְׁמ֥וֹת <WH8034> šə·mō·wṯ are the names הַגִּבֹּרִ֖ים <WH1368> hag·gib·bō·rîm mighty men: אֲשֶׁ֣ר <WH834> ’ă·šer - לְדָוִ֑ד <WH1732> lə·ḏā·wiḏ of David’s יֹשֵׁ֨ב <WH3429> yō·šêḇ Josheb-basshebeth בַּשֶּׁ֜בֶת <WH3429> baš·še·ḇeṯ ... תַּחְכְּמֹנִ֣י׀ <WH8461> taḥ·kə·mō·nî the Tahchemonite ( Tahchemonite is probably a variant of Hachmonite; see .) רֹ֣אשׁ <WH7218> rōš was chief הַשָּׁלִשִׁ֗י <WH7991> haš·šā·li·šî of the Three. ( Or chief among the captains) ה֚וּא <WH1931> hū He עֲדִינ֣וֹ <WH5722> ‘ă·ḏî·nōw wielded הָעֶצְנוֹ <WH6112> hå̄·ʿɛṣ·nō his spear עַל־ <WH5921> ‘al- against ( Some LXX manuscripts (see also ); Hebrew He was called Adino the Eznite because of) שְׁמֹנֶ֥ה <WH8083> šə·mō·neh eight מֵא֛וֹת <WH3967> mê·’ō·wṯ hundred [men], חָלָ֖ל <WH2491> ḥā·lāl whom he killed בְּפַ֥עַם <WH6471> bə·p̄a·‘am time. אֶחָד׃ס <WH259> ʾɛ·ḥå̄ḏ at one

וְאַחֲרוֹ <WH310> wə·ʾa·ḥă·rō Next in command was אֶלְעָזָ֥ר <WH499> ’el·‘ā·zār Eleazar בֶּן־ <WH1121> ben- son דֹּדִי <WH1734> dō·ḏī of Dodo ( Dodo is a variant of Dodai; see .) בֶּן־ <WH1121> ben- vvv אֲחֹחִ֑י <WH266> ’ă·ḥō·ḥî the Ahohite. בִּשְׁלֹשָׁ֨ה <WH7969> biš·lō·šāh As one of the three גִבֹּרִים <WH1368> ḡib·bō·rīm mighty men, עִם־ <WH5973> ‘im- he [went] with דָּוִ֗ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ David בְּחָֽרְפָ֤ם <WH2778> bə·ḥā·rə·p̄ām to taunt בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּים <WH6430> bap·pə·liš·tîm the Philistines נֶאֶסְפוּ־ <WH622> ne·’es·p̄ū- who had gathered שָׁ֣ם <WH8033> šām [at Pas-dammim]. לַמִּלְחָמָ֔ה <WH4421> lam·mil·ḥā·māh for battle וַֽיַּעֲל֖וּ <WH5927> way·ya·‘ă·lū retreated, אִ֥ישׁ <WH376> ’îš The men יִשְׂרָאֵֽל׃ <WH3478> yiś·rā·’êl of Israel

ה֣וּא <WH1931> hū but Eleazar קָם֩ <WH6965> qām stood his ground וַיַּ֨ךְ <WH5221> way·yaḵ and struck בַּפְּלִשְׁתִּ֜ים <WH6430> bap·pə·liš·tîm the Philistines עַ֣ד׀ <WH5704> ‘aḏ until כִּֽי־ <WH3588> kî- ... יָגְעָ֣ה <WH3021> yā·ḡə·‘āh grew weary יָד֗וֹ <WH3027> yā·ḏōw his hand וַתִּדְבַּ֤ק <WH1692> wat·tiḏ·baq and stuck יָדוֹ֙ <WH3027> yā·ḏōw ... אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to הַחֶ֔רֶב <WH2719> ha·ḥe·reḇ his sword. וַיַּ֧עַשׂ <WH6213> way·ya·‘aś brought about יְהוָ֛ה <WH3068> Yah·weh The LORD תְּשׁוּעָ֥ה <WH8668> tə·šū·‘āh victory גְדוֹלָ֖ה <WH1419> ḡə·ḏō·w·lāh a great בַּיּ֣וֹם <WH3117> bay·yō·wm day. הַה֑וּא <WH1931> ha·hū that וְהָעָ֛ם <WH5971> wə·hā·‘ām Then the troops יָשֻׁ֥בוּ <WH7725> yā·šu·ḇū returned אַחֲרָ֖יו <WH310> ’a·ḥă·rāw to him, אַךְ־ <WH389> ’aḵ- but only לְפַשֵּֽׁט׃ס <WH6584> lə·p̄aš·šêṭ to plunder the dead.

וְאַחֲרָ֛יו <WH310> wə·’a·ḥă·rāw And after him שַׁמָּ֥א <WH8037> šam·mā was Shammah בֶן־ <WH1121> ḇen- son אָגֵ֖א <WH89> ’ā·ḡê of Agee הָרָרִ֑י <WH2043> hā·rā·rî the Hararite. וַיֵּאָסְפ֨וּ <WH622> way·yê·’ā·sə·p̄ū had banded together פְלִשְׁתִּ֜ים <WH6430> p̄ə·liš·tîm When the Philistines לַחַיָּ֗ה <WH3896> la·ḥay·yāh near וַתְּהִי־ <WH1961> wat·tə·hî- - שָׁ֞ם <WH8033> šām - חֶלְקַ֤ת <WH2513> ḥel·qaṯ a field הַשָּׂדֶה֙ <WH7704> haś·śā·ḏeh ... מְלֵאָ֣ה <WH4392> mə·lê·’āh full of עֲדָשִׁ֔ים <WH5742> ‘ă·ḏā·šîm lentils, וְהָעָ֥ם <WH5971> wə·hā·‘ām [Israel’s] troops נָ֖ס <WH5127> nās fled מִפְּנֵ֥י <WH6440> mip·pə·nê from פְלִשְׁתִּֽים׃ <WH6430> p̄ə·liš·tîm [them].

וַיִּתְיַצֵּ֤ב <WH3320> way·yiṯ·yaṣ·ṣêḇ But [Shammah] took his stand בְּתוֹךְ־ <WH8432> bə·ṯō·wḵ- in the middle הַֽחֶלְקָה֙ <WH2513> ha·ḥel·qāh of the field, וַיַּצִּילֶ֔הָ <WH5337> way·yaṣ·ṣî·le·hā defended it, וַיַּ֖ךְ <WH5221> way·yaḵ and struck down אֶת־ <WH853> ’eṯ- - פְּלִשְׁתִּ֑ים <WH6430> pə·liš·tîm the Philistines. וַיַּ֥עַשׂ <WH6213> way·ya·‘aś brought about יְהוָ֖ה <WH3068> Yah·weh So the LORD תְּשׁוּעָ֥ה <WH8668> tə·šū·‘āh victory. גְדוֹלָֽה׃ס <WH1419> ḡə·ḏō·w·lāh a great

וַיֵּרְד֨וּ <WH3381> way·yê·rə·ḏū went down שְׁלֹשִׁים <WH7970> šə·lō·šīm three מֵהַשְּׁלֹשִׁ֣ים <WH7970> mê·haš·šə·lō·šîm of the thirty רֹ֗אשׁ <WH7218> rōš chief men וַיָּבֹ֤אוּ <WH935> way·yā·ḇō·’ū ... אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- At קָצִיר֙ <WH7105> qā·ṣîr harvest time, אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- to דָּוִ֔ד <WH1732> dā·wiḏ David אֶל־ <WH413> ’el- at מְעָרַ֖ת <WH4631> mə·‘ā·raṯ the cave עֲדֻלָּ֑ם <WH5725> ‘ă·ḏul·lām of Adullam, וְחַיַּ֣ת <WH2416> wə·ḥay·yaṯ while a company פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים <WH6430> pə·liš·tîm of Philistines חֹנָ֖ה <WH2583> ḥō·nāh was encamped בְּעֵ֥מֶק <WH6010> bə·‘ê·meq in the Valley רְפָאִֽים׃ <WH7497> rə·p̄ā·’îm of Rephaim.

וְדָוִ֖ד <WH1732> wə·ḏā·wiḏ David אָ֣ז <WH227> ’āz At that time בַּמְּצוּדָ֑ה <WH4686> bam·mə·ṣū·ḏāh was in the stronghold, וּמַצַּ֣ב <WH4673> ū·maṣ·ṣaḇ and the garrison פְּלִשְׁתִּ֔ים <WH6430> pə·liš·tîm of the Philistines אָ֖ז <WH227> ’āz ... בֵּ֥ית <WH1035> bêṯ vvv לָֽחֶם׃ <WH1035> lā·ḥem was at Bethlehem.

וַיִּתְאַוֶּ֥ה <WH183> way·yiṯ·’aw·weh longed [for water] דָוִ֖ד <WH1732> ḏā·wiḏ David וַיֹּאמַ֑ר <WH559> way·yō·mar and said, מִ֚י <WH4310> mî “ Oh, that someone יַשְׁקֵ֣נִי <WH8248> yaš·qê·nî would get me a drink מַ֔יִם <WH4325> ma·yim of water מִבֹּ֥אר <WH877> mib·bōr from the well בֵּֽית־ <WH1035> bêṯ- vvv לֶ֖חֶם <WH1035> le·ḥem of Bethlehem אֲשֶׁ֥ר <WH834> ’ă·šer -! ” בַּשָּֽׁעַר׃ <WH8179> baš·šā·‘ar near the gate
